intro: Phyllorkis alcicornis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed phyllorkis, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
